body.name: memzuoix Wireless Ergonomic Mouse 2.4G,800/1200/1600 DPI Large Wireless Mouse with USB Receiver,Optical Cordless Mice for Computer,Laptop,MacBook,Desktop,PC,6 Buttons,Red
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: 【ERGONOMIC MOUSE FOR YOUR RIGHT HAND】The wireless mouse with upgraded optical ergonomic and friendly design keeps your hand and arm staying more naturally. The ergonomic shape encourages healthy neutral "handshake" wrist and arm positions. Effectively smoother movement and less overall strain,compared with a regular wireless mouse.(The forward/back buttons are not compatible with Mac OS)

【2.4G WIRELESS, EASY TO USE】One USB receiver is inside the battery compartment. When using the optical cordless Mice,please remove the USB receiver and then install 2*AAA Dry Batteries(Buyer need to prepare Battery by himself/herself). Just Plug and Play! Mouse will turn to sleep mode in 7mins of inactivity for energy saving,easily activated by clicking any buttons.

【ADJUSTABLE 3 DPI HIGH SENSITIVITY】Upgraded 3 DPI 800/1200/1600 options, gaming mouse enables to adjust DPI as you want,provide sensitive, smooth and precise tracking. The vertical wireless mouse is also constructed with 6 buttons with multifunctional functions to improve productivity and efficiency in daily work.

【TOP RUBBER GRIP AND NICE MATTE COATING】Mouse texturized rubber grip ergonomically-design for your thumb rest and grip well. Great matte coating offer very comfortable touch,especially for people who works at the computer for hours.

【WIDE COMPATIBILITY】Ergonomic mouse wireless compatible with PC,Laptop,Computer,Desktop. System include Windows 8/9/10/XP,Windows Vista,Linux,with hardware connectivity by wireless USB Receiver. If you are using a Linux,need to set related software then mouse can be used normally.

【WIDELY USED】The vertical wireless mouse is suitable for use in the office,home,school. Lightness and easy to carry,you can put it in the computer bag and take it to the coffee shop,library,office and business trip.

【GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE】[90 Day Money-back Guarantee],[365 Days Warranty (replacement service) ],[Lifetime Technical Support]. If our vertical mouse does not fit your hand well,welcome to contact us for help,you'll get free replacement/refund without hassle at any time.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MEMZUOIX Optical Cordless Mice Designed In Line With Ergonomics Previous page Next page

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I love this mouse! I was used to carpal tunnel from previous mice, and my fingers would start cramping when I did a lot of editing at once... I'd have to rest them... stretch them out... then start again. This mouse has yet to cause my fingers to cramp even after hours of use. It's very responsive and recovers quickly after sleep mode.The only thing, and it's not a defect, but my index finger occasionally gets lazy and presses the clicker directly below it at random times. With a regular mouse this was rare, but with this one and it's 2 inch height, it happens more. Not a huge issue considering I no longer have carpal tunnel in my mouse hand! I don't use it for gaming, but do use it for meticulous photo and video editing. Awesome feel and comfort and response! Love it!* Update * After a couple months use, I am noticing the cursor lagging a bit, and stopping some. Occasionally it'll just stop mid movement. At first I thought it was my finger slightly slipping, but it's happening a lot. Dragging something across the screen and it'll let go mid-way. I tried changing the batteries, no difference, it's becoming annoying. I haven't had one of these vertical mice before, I'm wondering about getting another one to compare... will update one way or the other.* Update * So I purchased another very similar mouse to compare, the "VicTsing Ergonomic Mouse". Turns out being installed UNDER my desk was causing my "lag" in the Memzuoix. Now moved to a USB hub beside the mouse and w the lagging behind me, I continued to compare the two. The VicTsing doesn't feel nearly as stout as this Memzuoix mouse. There is just something that feels "cheaper" w/ the VicTsing. Advantage = Memzuoix Even though they look exactly the same, the VicTsing is ever-so-slightly taller, and I like that better for my large hands. Advantage = VicTsing However, the VicTsing doesn't have the extra "rubber like" grip where the thumb goes. Love that on the Memzuoix. Advantage = Memzuoix The buttons on the Memzuoix are ever-so-slightly more sensitive which means I get a lot of "accidental presses" from resting my finger even slightly and accidentally pressing a button, not so on the VicTsing. Advantage = VicTsing Now that I fixed the "lagging", they are equally responsive and accurate. Advantage = none They are about the same price, though the Memzuoix is slightly less. Advantage = Memzuoix I doubt either are made in USA. Advantage = none So which will I choose to use? I like the rubberized thumb grip, but like the ever-so-slightly taller profile of the VicTsing. With my bigger stronger hands and less accidental button presses, I will be using the VicTsing. If you don't have big hands, I'd recommend the Memzuoix.* Update * After a few weeks using the VicTsing, it's scroll wheel started to squeak, and it started missing clicks, I had to re-click often. Back to using the Memzuoix. Working flawlessly so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very comfortable, precise, durable, good value
reviews.reviewText: I bought a similar ergo mouse years ago and loved it. When it finally began to wear out, I struggled to find one with the same shape. Most are actually quite awkward as they tend to slip forward out of your hand. This one is a perfect clone of my original. The geometry is just right, it stays put comfortably in the pocket of your palm. This really has helped with CT issues that were being aggravated due to hours of CAD work. I will probably buy a few extras and store them away, as this is going to be my go-to mouse for the foreseeable future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the Money
reviews.reviewText: well made and works perfectly with my chromebook

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great until scroller stopped working
reviews.reviewText: The mouse worked really well until the scrolling piece stopped working for me this week (6 months after purchase). The ergonomic shape is great, and I like the feature that saves battery by putting the mouse in sleep mode if not moved for a few minutes. Unfortunately, the scroll piece stopped working this week—I would’ve rated 5 stars otherwise. Hoping to get in contact with the seller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best of Breed for medium-sized hands
reviews.reviewText: When I first started looking for vertical mice -- and I highly recommend switching, one review I saw recommended trying 4 different ones to find the right fit. I scoffed at first. A month later, I've tried 5. I'll outline what I tried and the pros/cons. For reference, my hand is medium-sized, 6.75 inches from base of palm to tip of middle finger.Anker's popular model: the biggest of all the mice I tried. Too big for my hand. Never felt comfortable, and the cursor tracking felt clunky.Jelly Comb for small hands and rechargeable version: Though they are listed at slightly different measurements, they are the exactly same size. This was my runner-up. Very smooth and ergonomic, just slightly too small. I found my palm wanted a half-inch more length to not have to clamp my fingers around it for purchase. But I'd recommend this one over the Memz for small hands. Also takes only one AA battery as opposed to two AAAs for all the others. Honestly I miss the sound and feel of the buttons with that one. Very crisp.Jelly Comb black/silver bluetooth dealie: Though this was the perfect size for my hand, it didn't feel comfortable, mostly because of the button placements. The scroll wheel was especially awkward, and the back button didn't always register. Also felt the cheapest overall.The Memz: I rather like the purple and the grip feel of it, as well as the texture thumb rest. I'm a tactile person, so that was a nice touch. It feels great in my hand. Slightly too big, but of all of them, the best fit. The tracking is spot on and the buttons are well placed and register all of my intents. So it wasn't a standout in any category, it was more of a jack of all trades.But now I'll be the lame-o recommending that you try as many as you can.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for pain in wrist
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because it relieves the pain in my wrist I was having from using a traditional mouse. This is great for those remote workers like myself, who sit at a computer for 8+hours a day. No more carpal tunnel pains in my wrist!! Its very comfortable to use whether you're at your desk or in bed working from home like myself:)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Stopped Working after 16 Months
reviews.reviewText: This was a great mouse for helping with my wrist pain. It worked great but did go through batteries quickly.However, I am not one to turn it off overnight. I used it daily for work. I purchased in July 2022 and now December 2023 it has died. Sad to see it go and wished it had held up longer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Feel but scrolling wheel does not work
reviews.reviewText: Scrolling wheel does not scroll smoothly. It almost like a glitch. While you are trying to scroll one way, it skips the opposite direction and doesn't scroll completely in the direction you need it to.
Relieves strain on hand and wrist for large hand. All buttons work with MacOS. Comfortable and easy to use
Exactly what you need, no more, no less. Ergonomic and comfortable. Great wireless mouse.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good mouse, better than ordinary non-ergonomic ones
reviews.reviewText: It's a good mouse, but you will still feel that wrist discomfort even with using it on a supportive mouse pad. It's actually better than ordinary Bluetooth mousepads, but there's no special help for the wrist discomfort!

reviews.reviewerName: 澁谷　敏郎澁谷　敏郎
reviews.reviewTitle: 残念ながら 乾電池が必要です！！
reviews.reviewText: 右手首の腱鞘炎対策で購入しました。使い心地もなかなか良くて、気に入ってますが、まさか乾電池が必要とは驚きました。過去に何個もコードレスマウスを購入しましたが、この時代に乾電池とは驚きでした。

reviews.reviewTitle: 最初はデカいと思ったが
reviews.reviewText: マウスにしてはややデカく感じ、形状的に違和感があり…ただ使い慣れてくると腕が疲れない。特に慣れてきて長時間使うと結構楽なのがわかる。事務仕事で長時間マウス使う人にはオススメ。
